name: mandarin production, sorted and graded | mandarin, processing grade | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21949/documentation

The dataset describes the packhouse stage of the mandarin value chain. The reference flow is 1kg of fresh grade mandarin  to be sent to the market and processing grade mandarin that is sent to the food industry (juices, canned fruit...). After being harvested, mandarins are sent to packhouses for sorting/grading and packing. The mandarins are jumble packed meaning that they aren't packed in a specific pattern, but boxes are filled to a specific weight (15 kg). Details on the packaging material required are given below.;CORRUGATED CARDBOARD: 0.07647 kg of corrugated cardboard for 1 kg of sorted and graded mandarin. The amount of corrugated board used was calculated to 57.2 kg corrugated board / ton of soft citrus marketed and then scaled to the reference flow of 1 kg. Data came from different packhouse from different subregions in WC province.;KRAFT PAPER, BLEACHED: 0.000245 kg of kraft paper are use per k1 of sorted and graded mandarin. Soft citrus fruit for local and export market is either packed loosely in cardboard boxes with inner packaging consisting of pulp (kraft paper).;PACKAGING FILM, LOW DENSITY POLYETHYLENE: 0.000153 kg of packaging film are used per 1 kg fo sorted and graded mandarin. Packaging films are used to pack the boxes when they are placed onto pallets.;POLYPROPYLENE, GRANULATE AND THE EXTRUSION OF POLYPROPYLENE: are used to model plastic bins which are made of polypropylene and have a  lifespan of 30 years (Jumbo Bin in the fruit growing industry; Mpac Plastic Continers). A 0.00026 kg of polyepropylene is used per 1kg of sorted and graded mandarin.

The activity starts with the mandarin transported from the orchard to the packhouse facilities.

The activity ends with the mandarins sorted by grade and ready for the market. Packaging is excluded. From the farm the fruit is transported in crates (plastic or wooden) in small trucks or trailers pulled by tractors for shorter distances or large vehicles for longer distances to the centralised packhouses which are generally off-site (Ortmann, 2005). From here the fruit is taken to the packaging lines where it is graded and sorted and thereafter packed into corrugated cardboard boxes, which are then packed onto pallets with dimension 1x1.2 m. The activity includes the facilty and the machineries (building hall and conveyor belts).
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0123:Growing of citrus fruits

processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data from Company Budget Report (Combuds), previuos study done on the Mandarin sector in South Africa (Konig, 2015) and CGA (2016).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data from Company Budget Report (Combuds), previuos study done on the Mandarin sector in South Africa (Konig, 2015) and CGA (2016).

exchanges.description: The reference flow is 1kg of fresh grade mandarin to be sent to the market and processing grade mandarin to be sent to the food industry to be further processed (juicing or canning). This represents the 11,69% of the mandarin that comes from the farm stage.

flow.name: mandarin, processing grade
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0123:Growing of citrus fruits

exchanges.description: This accounts for the wastes that may occur during the grading and sorting of the mandaring at packhouses: this represents the 1,72% of the mandarin that comes from the farm stage. The fruit making up the waste component is a combinaiton of incoming fruit not conforming to certain criteria fro packing due to size or damage during transit or packing.

flow.name: biowaste
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

exchanges.description: The area of the packhouse was assumed to be 2.82*e-10 m2/yr/kg of marketed soft citrus. Data came from two citrus packhouses: African Packers and Ponders End Traders Packhouse (Afrifresh.co.za, 2015).  Lifetime expectancy was assumed to 50 years (Kellenberger at al., 2007)

flow.name: building, hall
flow.category: F:Construction/41:Construction of buildings/410:Construction of buildings/4100:Construction of buildings

defaultProvider.name: market for building, hall | building, hall | Cutoff, U
defaultProvider.category: F:Construction/41:Construction of buildings/410:Construction of buildings/4100:Construction of buildings

exchanges.description: Electricity at the packhouse stage is used for the operation of conveyor belts, lighting and other machinery. The amount of electricity used was calculated to 55.5 kWh grid electricity/ ton of soft citrus marketed and then scaled to the reference flow of 1 kg. Data came from different packhouse from different subregions in WC province.

flow.name: electricity, low voltage
flow.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

exchanges.description: The ration of conveyor belt length to packhouse area was assumed to be 0.25m/m2. Data came from Rekopane farm in Nothern Cape. Lifetime expectancy was assumed to 25 years (Kellenberger at al., 2007)
